Article.ArticleTitle: Synthesis of an Iron(IV) Aqua-Oxido Complex Using Ozone as an Oxidant.

AbstractText: The iron(IV) oxido complex [(tmc)Fe=O(OTf)]OTf with the macrocyclic ligand 1,4,8,11-tetramethyl-1,4,8,11-tetraazacyclo-tetradecane (tmc) has been synthesized using ozone as an oxidant. By adding water to this compound the complex [(H<sub>2</sub> O)(tmc)Fe=O)](OTf)<sub>2</sub> could be prepared. This complex is important in regard to a better understanding of the reactivity of Fe<sup>IV</sup> oxido complexes. Mössbauer measurements using the solid compound showed an isomer shift of δ=0.19 mm s<sup>-1</sup> and a quadrupole splitting ΔE<sub>Q</sub> =1.38 mm s<sup>-1</sup> , confirming the high-valent Fe<sup>IV</sup> state. DFT calculations were performed and led to an assignment of triplet spin multiplicity. Crystallographic characterization of [(H<sub>2</sub> O)(tmc)Fe=O)](OTf)<sub>2</sub> as well as of starting materials [(tmc)Fe(CH<sub>3</sub> CN)](OTf)<sub>2</sub> and [(tmc)Fe(OTf)]OTf together with previous results strongly suggest that [(H<sub>2</sub> O)(tmc)Fe=O)](OTf)<sub>2</sub> was formed similar to the oxido-hydroxido tautomerism analogous to heme systems.
